newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuanian bourse plans official list-report.
newsitem.headline: Lithuanian bourse plans official list-report.

text.p: The Lithuanian stock exchange is planning to launch an official share list of the best and most reliable of the country's companies, newspaper Verslo Zinios said on Friday.
It quoted stock market trading list and list formation head Saulius Malinauskas as saying that the exchange had already invited top companies to join.

He said that leading banks Vilnius Bank and Hermis Bank, brewer Kalnapilis, timber products firm Medienos Plaushas, dairy company Birzai Milk and the Rokishkis cheese manufacturer could all be included.
To secure a place on the list, companies must have an audit according to international standards and have share capital of at least five million litas.
There is no official or secondary list at the Lithuanian bourse at the moment with all companies simply split into a general corporate list, a bank list and an investment fund list.
